awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Natural Seismicity Investigation of Active Continental Breakup in the Western Woodlark Basin
awd_abstract_narration: Funds are being provided to study the seismicity of an active continental breakup in the western Woodlark Basin, offshor Papua New Guinea.  Low-angle normal detachment is a fundamental process in passive margin evolution but conflicts with basic Andersonian tenet of frictional slip on faults.  24 to 35 degree low-angle slip planes are know in the low-angle seismicity.  A marine-land passive seismic experiment will be undertaken, focused on a region of high-localized strain.  Seafloor instruments will be arrayed to record microseismicity and PASSCAL instruments will be deployed on surrounding islands to record regional seismicity.  ODP drilling will provide additional constraints on faulting.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
